name: The Conference Park from venuebirmingham

reviews.text: I stayed at Birmingham as part of a conference, The accommodation was excellent. It was spacious clean and modern. The complementary wifi was a good extra as many people visiting are working while away.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: The breakfast offered a fantastic selection, and the cooked breakfast was cooked to order and incredibly tasty.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will certainly be staying here again.
reviews.title: very basic, but great value & good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in hotel for one night. No lift to 2nd floor and as I was ill at the time I found this to be very irritating especially as it went up to the 1st floor. There was no mention of this when booking. The room was very basic but clean. The food in the restaurant was good but a little overpriced. However there was no direction whether to go straight into breakfast or wait to be seated in the morming. The staff walked by several times and did not offer assistance. An ok hotel for one night.
reviews.title: Oh dear

reviews.text: we were attending a function at the University so staed here, rooms were basic, tired, but clean
reviews.title: Nice breakfast shame about the hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night while visiting the University. Good location. Easy walking distance to most Departments and to the train station. Unfortunately, that is about the only good point. The room was shabby, dated and coming apart at the seams. The street-light directly outside my window gave the place and eery orange glow all night even with the curtains as tightly shut as I could get them. The bathroom was pretty shocking in terms of bits falling off everywhere and a shower that was little more than a tepid trickle.
reviews.title: Throw-back to the 70's

reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and here if is not much.
reviews.title: Makes you feel like a real student

reviews.text: I booked the accommodation for 3 nights whilst on a course at the uni, as it is close and has parking. The accommodation is basic, no frills student accommodation, which is fine if you go prepared for basics, not luxury. Walls are very thin - no privacy and you will hear all oblutions from guests in the next room. Buffet breakfast was OK, as was the evening meal, but if staying for several nights I'd advise escaping for a bit of variety.
reviews.title: Great value for a short stay

reviews.text: I just needed a simple room for one night after attending a concert at the magnificent Birmingham Symphony Hall. I looked for low cost, last minute rooms in the city centre but found nothing suitable so took a well priced offer from the Birmingham University Conference Centre instead (£50 all inclusive). Located only a couple of miles outside the city centre, it’s convenient for the centre’s attractions but also away from the noise and bustle. Parking was free and spacious outside the various conference buildings, and check in at Lucas House painless. My room was actually in an adjacent building but on the short walk I encountered a free water fountain and fresh-brewed complimentary coffee .
reviews.title: Good for one night

reviews.text: My room – a single – had everything one would expect from a 4* hotel – tea making, complimentary mineral water, TV, fan heater and even ironing facilities. Wi-Fi internet was also available for no extra charge. The room and bathroom were not spacious but perfectly adequate for my short stay – with heated towel rails and complimentary shower gels, soap and conditioner.
reviews.title: Very basic accommodations close to the university
Booking cancelled by Hotel at short notice
reviews.text: I would love to be able to comment on the standard of accomodation in this hotel. Unfortunately I can't because I never got the chance to stay here. The hotel cancelled my reservation at very short notice and left me high and dry. Not very funny when the reason for the stay was an important interview.

According to Booking.com the hotel should have arranged alternative accomodation at the same or higher standard and arranged transport at their expense. No such luck. If you are considering this hotel for an important visit I would think again.
reviews.title: Look for Logan House!
Disappointing!
reviews.text: We stayed here recently while my husband had business at the university. The most important thing to know is that the sign is marked Conference Park and the building is marked Logan House even though all the pre-stay correspondence (at least in our case) is marked Venue Birmingham. There's no sign that says Venue Birmingham!

Once we found it we were very happy with the place. The location is perfect if you need to be near the university. The room was comfortable and looked over a quiet lawn and garden. It did have some charmingly retro aspects, like a mixer tap that's not really a mixer tap and lots of strange narrow doors lining the halls. The wifi was great. The staff was wonderful and so was the breakfast. I'd stay again, but do think the signage difference should be better communicated before you arrive.
reviews.title: An excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed in hotel for one night, no lift & was on the second floor with heavy bags to carry! The restaurant was closed although there was no mention of this when I booked, really really annoying as I had had a really tiring day & didn't know the area - ended up with a delivery curry!! Got to be a first when staying in a 4* hotel!!!! The room was shabby & tired, the pillow resembled a board & was pretty uncomfortable. The staff were friendly & helpful but didn't make up for the closed restaurant, shabby room & squashed pillow.
reviews.title: perfect welcome in Birmingham

reviews.text: I was expecting the worst after reading all of the tripadvisor reviews but upon arriving at my room, I was pleasantly surprised. I was doing a course at the local university and this hotel is conveniently located a 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Very Nice & Perfect For The University
Try and find it with ease
reviews.text: The "hotel" is an old student hall of residence which has been converted into a 4* hotel. The room itself was very small but perfectly functional. It was nicely decorated, the room was quiete and the bed very comfortable.
After the first day, my dustbin was emptied but the bed was not made and it didn't look as though the shower was cleaned. On the second day, the bedroom and bathroom were cleaned thoroughly.
reviews.title: Student nostalgia!

reviews.text: There's Dove shower gel/shampoo provided along with free wifi, a kettle and tea/coffee making facilities but no mini bar.
reviews.title: basic clean accom but.....

reviews.text: There is little to choose from at breakfast from the "continental" section. There's cereal, toast, a croissant and chocolate type pastry, neither of which were particularly tasty. Hot food is cooked to order and each day this was brought quickly to the table and of good quality.
reviews.title: Lucas house NOT Logan house

aka: The Conference Park From Venuebirmingham Hotel Birmingham
description: We are a meeting, conference, exhibition and wedding venue at the University of Birmingham. We are only 3 miles from Birmingham City Centre, but our conference park is set amongst green parklands, just off the University of Birmingham campus. We have hosted the 2010 General Election leaders debate and the BBC Antiques Roadshow; we can offer full catering, hotel accommodation and bed and breakfast.
